title: 106_hr3687
content: The Act titled "Canyons of the Ancients National Conservation Area Act" aims to conserve and protect unique historical, cultural, scientific, archaeological, natural, and educational resources in Dolores and Montezuma Counties, Colorado for present and future generations by establishing the Canyons of the Ancients as a National Conservation Area. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. This section defines key terms such as Conservation Area, Council, Management plan, Map, and Secretary. The Canyons of the Ancients National Conservation Area in Colorado consists of approximately 164,000 acres of public land in Dolores and Montezuma Counties. The Secretary is required to submit a map and legal description of the area to Congress within 30 days of the enactment of the Act. These documents will have the same legal force as the Act itself, with the Secretary allowed to make corrections for clerical errors. The management of the Conservation Area in Colorado aims to conserve, protect, and enhance its resources in accordance with relevant laws. The description of the area is available for public inspection in specific offices. The Secretary will determine permissible uses in the Conservation Area to further its established purposes. Motorized vehicles in the area are only allowed on designated roads and trails, except for emergencies or administrative needs. Access to oil, gas, or carbon dioxide leases is permitted via designated routes. Access to private property for oil, gas, or carbon dioxide leases in the Conservation Area is allowed via designated routes. Federal land within the area is withdrawn from various forms of entry and disposal under public land laws and mining laws. The Conservation Area allows access for oil, gas, and carbon dioxide leases via designated routes. Federal land within the area is withdrawn from entry and disposal under public land and mining laws. Hunting and trapping are permitted within the Conservation Area in accordance with applicable laws of the United States and Colorado. The Secretary may designate hunting and trapping zones in the Conservation Area for public safety, administration, or public use. Grazing leases in the area will be managed according to existing laws. The Secretary will develop a management plan for the Conservation Area within 4 years of this Act, outlining appropriate land uses and incorporating decisions from other plans. The management plan for the Conservation Area will consider information from studies of the land and historical community involvement. There will be no buffer zones around the Conservation Area, allowing activities outside the area to continue. The Secretary may acquire non-federally owned land in the Conservation Area from willing sellers through purchase, exchange, or donation. Upon acquisition, the boundary of the Conservation Area will be modified to include the new land, which will be managed according to the Act. The Secretary is also authorized to establish interpretive sites within the Conservation Area to showcase its resources. The Conservation Area's resources include archaeological, natural, and educational resources. The Act does not reserve any water rights, alter provisions of the Wilderness Act or the Federal Land Policy and Management Act for wilderness resources, or affect National Park Service lands within the area. The Conservation Area's resources include archaeological, natural, and educational resources. SEC. 5. ADVISORY COUNCIL. The Secretary will establish the "Canyons of the Ancients National Conservation Area Advisory Council" to advise on the management plan. The Council, consisting of 15 members appointed by the Secretary, must comply with the Federal Advisory Committee Act and the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. Members include representatives from Dolores County Commission, Montezuma County Commission, Ute Mountain Ute Indian Tribe, and 12 members residing nearby. The Canyons of the Ancients National Conservation Area Advisory Council will consist of 12 members from southwestern Colorado with backgrounds relevant to the area's purposes and stakeholder interests. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Sums necessary for this Act will be appropriated.
